snippet: The Securities and Exchange Commission accused the bank of doling out three internships to appease officials at a Middle Eastern sovereign wealth fund.
abstract: Securities and Exchange Commission announces it has reached settlement with Bank of New York Mellon over bribery accusations concerning granting of internships to relatives of officials at client sovereign wealth fund based in Middle East; bank will pay $14.8 million to settle matter.

byline.original: By MICHAEL J. de la MERCED

lead_paragraph: The Securities and Exchange Commission accused the bank of doling out three internships to appease officials at a Middle Eastern sovereign wealth fund.

headline.main: Bank of New York Mellon Settles Bribery Case Over Interns
